metadata.title: CVE-2020-15669 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
When aborting an operation, such as a fetch, an abort signal may be deletedwhile alerting the objects to be notified. This results in a use-after-freeand we presume that with enough effort it could have been exploited to runarbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 68.12 andThunderbird < 68.12.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15669` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
